sense.name: transit
sense.commentary: transportation system - a facility consisting of the means and equipment necessary for the movement of passengers or goods
sense.examples: My transportation is old and rusty. Light rail transportation is clean and runs frequently between PA and NJ.

sense.name: moving
sense.commentary: TRANSPORTATION[+event] tranfer, transferral, conveyance - the act of transporting something form one location to another
sense.examples: The transportation was much faster on SEPTA than in a city cab. Transportation of perishables across country must be fast.

sense.name: freight rate
sense.commentary: the price paid for and the commercial enterprise of transporting goods and materials
sense.examples: I hope that transportation of refrigerated items is charged by the pound.

sense.name: DoT
sense.commentary: Department of Transporation, Transportation, DoT - the United States federal department that institutes and coordinates national transportation programs; created in 1996
sense.examples: The Department of Transporation is providing assistance to residents affected by the local road blocks.

sense.name: exile
sense.commentary: TRANSPORTATION[+event] deportation, expatriation - The act of expelling a person from their native land
sense.examples: Men in exile dream of hope. His transportation to a penal colony was long. The sentence was one of transportation for life.
